t: Clean Garments for the High Priest
Then*p he showed me Joshua the high priest standing before the angel of the Lord,*s and Satan standing at his right side to accuse him.
The Lord*s said to Satan, “The Lord*s rebuke you, Satan! The Lord,*s who has chosen Jerusalem, rebuke you! Is not this man a burning stick snatched from the fire?”
Now*p Joshua was dressed in filthy clothes as he stood before the angel.
The angel said to those who were standing before him, “Take off his filthy clothes.” Then*p he said to Joshua, “See, I have taken away your sin, and I will put fine garments on you.”
Then*p I said, “Put a clean turban on his head.” So they put a clean turban on his head and clothed him, while the angel of the Lord*s stood by.
The*p angel of the Lord*s gave this charge to Joshua:

“This is what the Lord*s Almighty says: ‘If you will walk in obedience to me and keep my requirements, then you will govern my house and have charge of my courts, and I will give you a place among these standing here.
“ ‘Listen,*p High Priest Joshua, you and your associates seated before you, who are men symbolic of things to come: I am going to bring my servant, the Branch.

See, the stone I have set in front of Joshua! There are seven eyes on that one stone, and I will engrave an inscription on it,’ says the Lord*s Almighty, ‘and I will remove the sin of this land in a single day.
“ ‘In*p that day each of you will invite your neighbor to sit under your vine and fig tree,’ declares the Lord*s Almighty.”
